item.title: Manager- Data Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Manager- Data Analytics

Job Description

  • Obtain an in-depth understanding of HEF products and segments in order to effectively provide value-added insights
  • Build reporting that measures the success of new pricing strategies under Customized Pricing, measuring champion vs. challenger performance and make strategy recommendations
  • Utilize pricing optimization tool to create pricing proposal based on previous results and current rate environment.
  • Enhance the existing Tableau tools to incorporate on-going user feedback, deliver further efficiency through automation of processes and expose timely and relevant information to end-users
  • Work with the HEF Pricing team and others to advice on pricing decisions through use of reporting, leading edge analytics, measurement of key performance indicators, and early detection of trends & anomalies
  • Participate in building new predictive model to enable insights and facilitate pricing decision making process
  • Leverage data-driven tactics to provide key analytical and business insights to support senior leaders in managing the pricing strategy for the Home Equity portfolio
  • Create materials to communicate insights developed either through new reporting or specific stakeholder presentations and working sessions
  • Monitor the use of delegated pricing authorities to ensure compliance

Must-have  

  • 2-4 years of experience in an analytical and reporting capacity supporting a line of business across major Financial Institution(s).  
  • Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret complex data and provide insights to senior management
  • SQL knowledge and experience, including developing and optimizing complex queries
  • Proficient in use of SAS, Tableau, Excel, PPT, or other data visualization tools
  • Self-starter—ability to work and think through problems and assignments in a self-directed manner
  • Excellent communication skills along with ability to partner effectively with and direct both internal and external partners

Nice-to-have

  • Passionate about the mortgage industry, and being part of a greater team
  • Knowledge of Data Science / predictive modelling / machine learning is an asset
  • Experience in Python and R programming
  • Knowledge of Linx, experience with RBC database and mortgage data  (only show on internal posting)

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, fair compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
  • Leaders who help your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team

Job Summary

RBC Home Equity Financing (HEF) is the leading lender of residential mortgages in Canada, and RBC’s single largest business with over $300 Billion in assets.
As the Manager, Data Analytics within HEF Pricing Team, you will use advanced analytics to provide senior leadership insights into the impacts of pricing strategies on the HEF portfolio. Also, you will maintain reporting package that focuses on the pricing aspect of the HEF business that will help drive key decisions with a high degree of impact. Furthermore, you will leverage pricing optimization tools to generate monthly pricing proposal under Customized Pricing strategies.

item.title: Regional Analyst - Data Analytics and Technology
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Regional Analyst - Data Analytics and Technology

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

In this role you will provide analytical and technical support for all of CMR\'s data analytics and technology needs. The individual has an agile mindset to challenge the status quo and leads the transformation of Credit Management and Recoveries utilizing data, analytics and technology to improve the bank’s overall performance.  You will utilize a variety of data sources, to provide comprehensive end to end data reporting solutions through development of new and existing reporting capabilities on existing data.  You will be responsible for the end to end delivery of various source system analytics to analyze and recommend course of action to senior leadership across Caribbean Collections. 

What will you do?

  • Serve as SME for technology and data transformation through a combination of requirements gathering, research and development, analysis, testing and QA  for CMR Caribbean
  • Utilize strong knowledge and experience in IT methodology and host systems to capitalize on digital platforms to bring to life RBC’s digital roadmap for the CMR group
  • Responsible for the development of new and ad hoc business reporting for CMR Caribbean banking with provision of BAU and developmental requests per assigned schedules
  • Focus on quality, accuracy and consistency of reporting packages ensuring factual information is provided
  • Support as needed/necessary other Reporting COE teams
  • Provide SME support through technical and data projects, initiatives and incidents for CMR Caribbean

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • Degree in Computer Science, Mathematics/Statistics, related field or equivalent related experience in programming or data analytics
  • Combination experience of analytic and programming technology e.g Tableau, SQL, SAS, Datameer, VB, C+ etc.
  • Expert Knowledge of MS Excel analytical and macro tools
  • Knowledge of Project Management process/disciplines
  • Good knowledge of RBC data sources and infrastructure

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • An unique opportunity for personal and professional growth
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive and high performing team
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact

Job Summary

The role provides analytical and technical support for all of CMR\'s data analytics and technology needs. The individual has an agile mindset to challenge the status quo and leads the transformation of CMR utilizing data, analytics and technology to improve the banks overall performance.

item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Supervisor, Data Service Delivery

Job Description

What will you do?

  • Responsible for the Day to Day deliverables: Delivery of Portfolio Securities Valuation for Fund Administered under various platforms (12 Entities of the Group) Including: CPS Pricing L1/L2 – FX & Interest Rates L1/L2 – Stale Price Analysis L1 – Customer Support L1/L2 – EUCs Update and Daily Maintenance L1/L2 – CPS Parameterization L3 (Day to Day) – (*L1:Maker / L2: Reviewer / L3: Super User Access)
  • Promote quality of deliverables by motivating, coaching and developing team members
  • Ensure cross training and rotation of duties occurs on a regular basis to increase operational efficiency and reduce operational risk
  • Ensure all operational issues are treated in a timely and effective manner
  • Ensure all processes are documented in the procedures manual and are maintained on an on-going basis
  • Maintain an in depth knowledge of BCP procedures, policies and plans
  • Ensure compliance with and completion of code of conduct / RBC I&TS compliance manual / control self-assessment
  • People Management for daily operations, on boarding
  • Provide and maintain indicators to the management (KPI / KQI)
  • Act as deputy manager
  • Participate with manager in goal setting, mid-year, and year end appraisals of staff

What do you need to succeed?

Internal Applicant: Must be at least 12 months in current role.

Must-have

  • As a guideline to ensure a reasonable time is spent in a role, you are expected to have at least 12 months of service in your current role for any lateral move

  • PC literate in MS Office applications Excel and
  • Word Knowledge of different investment instrument types
  • Motivated, flexible, able to be part of a team

Nice-to-have

  • Any prior banking experience in operations / Back office is a plus
  • Systems literate,
  • Good Verbal and written communication skills
  • Process Improvement and innovation

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including performance based bonuses, flexible benefits, and competitive compensation
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • A world-class training program in financial services
  • A collaborative dynamic culture where personal initiative and hard work are recognized and rewarded

Job Summary

What is the opportunity?

RBC Investor & Treasury Services Malaysia is a processing center of operational excellence supporting 10 countries across three geographical time zones. Malaysia is one of two operational processing hubs that supports Custody - Transaction Management; Settlements; NAV Production; Fund Reporting; Shareholder Services; Global Fund Platform Services; Data Service Delivery; Entitlements – income and corporate actions and Reconciliations. The country employs a Global Operating Model to maximise efficiencies across times zones and supports a 24/5 operational capability. The objectives for Malaysia are to enhance the scalability of our global operations, improve service quality via our ‘centres of excellence’ and to implement/leverage standard processes globally.

The team is supporting Global region

item.title: Snr Manager, Data Management Operations
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Snr Manager, Data Management Operations

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

In this role of Senior Manager, Data Management, RBC Global Asset Management (GAM), you will partner with business leaders, data governance and project teams to ensure the completeness and accuracy of enterprise data within Global Asset Management, with a focus on one or more assigned data domains. Build trust and confidence across the organization around enterprise data and data processes. This position will play an important role in GAM’s vision to become a data driven firm, and will serve as a go-to expert for the data that is managed by GAM’s Data Governance, and how to leverage it for business value. For more information, please visit: https://www.rbcgam.com/en/ca/

What will you do?

  • Accountable for one or more specific enterprise data domains, you will work across the organization to understand enterprise data needs, data requirements and usage. Conduct research related to data requirements and present proposals to appropriate teams. Where needed, work across multiple business teams to achieve consensus on key data decisions including sourcing, classifications, and definitions.

  • Lead the work of one or more Data Working Groups, minute decisions and provide input to the Data Governance Council for key decisions that need to be escalated.

  • Define accountability for making data decisions – raise issues, risks and business decisions to appropriate teams.

  • Prioritize data work to ensure optimal value across projects and the organization

  • Join an agile data squad and provide guidance on data definitions, locations, and workflows.

  • Work with data squads to document and translate data requirements into technical requirements

  • Join an agile data squad and provide guidance on data within the organization.

  • In partnership with the data governance disciplines, business teams and business technology:

    • Document data definitions, create data quality controls and monitors

    • Develop data integration processes

    • Define operational workflows for maintaining data

    • Plan for data staging and delivery to reporting and downstream applications

  • Communicate regularly with project and business teams on data readiness and to identify data gaps and new requirement

What do you need to succeed?

Must Have

  • Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, IT/MIS/CS or related experience

  • Demonstrated reporting, data analysis experience, especially working with complex business processes and specific data domains

  • Strong communication, interpersonal skills with the ability to communicate effectively with business users and technical individuals

  • Understanding of data flows, data architecture and data querying ability, including comfort with writing Oracle and MS SQL queries for data- mining and analysis

Nice to Have

  • Experience working in financial investment industry ideally within an asset management group

  • Decision making capabilities including problem solving approaches

  • Ability to solve specific business problems, while keeping an overall business and data vision in mind.

  • Experience working within a data warehousing environment.

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable

  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities

  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact

  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team

  • Flexible work/life balance options

  • Opportunities to do challenging work

  • Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities

  • Access to a variety of job opportunities across business and geographies

item.title: Associate Director, Market Risk Stress Testing
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Associate Director, Market Risk Stress Testing

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

The role of the Market Risk Stress Testing team is to ensure that the link between the current market environment across all asset classes and RBC’s market risk profile is established, understood, and managed effectively.  The team develops, implements, and analyzes stress scenarios to provide senior management, business heads, and regulators with views on market risk concentrations and capital adequacy.  The team is also responsible for ensuring compliance with all regulatory stress testing requirements for market risk.

As Associate Director, you are responsible for contributing to the team’s mandate, including the continued development of the market risk stress testing program, with an emphasis on the design, implementation and analysis of relevant scenarios. 

What will you do?

  • Conduct analysis on and produce summaries of potential concentrations and trends in risk that could result in significant financial loss under adverse market conditions. Demonstrate a deep, detailed understanding of trading and non-trading market risks at RBC as well as the current market environment, to provide senior management with confidence in the reasonableness of stress test outcomes such that action can be taken as deemed necessary
  • Participate in the scenario design process including identifying all material market risks, appropriately calibrating stress shocks, and reviewing and challenging scenario designs approaches and assumptions
  • Execute the market risk components of all regulatory stress tests – such stress tests are critical in assuring regulators that RBC is well-positioned to withstand severe but plausible market events.  Conduct thorough analysis, including detailed reviews and market research, to ensure the completeness and reasonableness of results
  • Document, challenge and provide expertise on market risk stress testing methodologies and assumptions across RBC.  These methodologies must be properly justified and documented in compliance with regulatory standards
  • Provide requirements in the design of key components of the strategic market risk platform that are related to stress testing, and test the IT builds before promotion to production
  • Gather findings and results of stress tests, methodology changes, and system changes to business heads and internal review committees

What do you need to succeed?

  • MBA, MA or MS or equivalent with emphasis in finance, economics or a quantitative discipline.
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills, including prior experience with presenting to senior audiences
  • Thorough knowledge of traded products including derivatives and their associated risks.
  • Detailed knowledge of MS Excel, SQL, and Python
  • Ability to work collaboratively and under tight deadlines

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual. We offer:

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing
  • opportunities 
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team in a growth area
  • Opportunities to do challenging work with enterprise impact

Job Summary

Responsible for contributing to the market risk stress testing program, with an emphasis on the design, implementation and analysis of relevant scenarios

item.title: Manager, AML Data Management
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Manager, AML Data Management

Job Description

 

 WHAT IS THE OPPORTUNITY?  

The AML Data Management team is mandated to execute the Enterprise AML and Financial Crimes Data Management Program that will govern data used within the enterprise to meet regulatory requirements and expectations, while accommodating RBC’s innovation framework.  You will contribute to sustaining and enhancing the oversight and governance of data used within key processes of the AML and Financial Crimes (such as sanctions screening and transaction monitoring).  You will have an opportunity to liaise with AML Compliance, AML FIU, the Chief Data Office, DNA, and other business partners to execute data management strategies and protocols to maintain and enhance an effective and efficient AML and Financial Crimes Program at RBC.

WHAT WILL YOU DO?  

  • Analyze large data sets in conjunction with data dictionaries, system documentation, and end user documentation to understand business context and translate into data requirements from an enterprise AML Program perspective
  • Perform data profiling and analysis of data sources to assess data availability and ensure AML data requirements are continually satisfied
  • Perform comprehensive data analysis to measure data quality in accordance with the CDO data quality strategy. Define data quality rules and scorecards for ongoing monitoring and measurement of data quality, particularly from an AML Program perspective
  • Evaluate data quality measurements and scorecards to identify data quality issues that may impact the effectiveness of the AML Program. Leverage enterprise data governance tools to document detailed data lineage and data transformations through liaison between business stakeholders and IT partners
  • Perform post implementation verification to ensure AML data requirements from data sources have been accurately and successfully captured in target data models/schemas
  • Assist with the development of high level plans and user stories for completion of AML data requirements and acceptance phases of projects, improving in the level of detail and accuracy of estimates over time

WHAT DO YOU NEED TO SUCCEED?

 Must have

  • Undergraduate degree coupled with change management experience in complex programs with high frequency of requests and multiple priorities
  • 5+ years of technical experience using SQL to interface with various databases, data sources, and file systems (RBDMS, OLTP/OLAP, flat files, UNIX, HDFS)
  • Understanding of data governance and data quality concepts and processes such as Data Quality Controls, Authoritative Data Sources, Master and Reference Data, etc.
  • Proficient with SAS programming and its macro language to perform quantitative data analysis and transformations.  Other expertise with R, Hadoop, VBA, Java and C++  or other related experience desirable
  • Deadline-driven and results-oriented; able to meet consistently high quality standards while handling a variety of tasks and deadlines simultaneously

Nice-to-have

  • Knowledge of reconciliation design, data integration, data sourcing, data quality reporting, and exception resolution processes. As well as knowledge of data warehousing, front-to-back data flows and processing in banking database systems
  • Ability to facilitate between and influence key decision makers
  • Strategic thinker with excellent interpersonal skills to work across functions and businesses
  • Certified Anti-Money Laundering Specialist (CAMS) designation or other related certifications

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Opportunities to do challenging work
  • Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities
  • Flexible work/life balance options

RBC requires as a condition of employment that all successful candidates in the United States and Canada be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to their start date, and may require proof of the same. Reasonable accommodation is available where required by law.

item.title: Senior Officer, Client Data Services
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Senior Officer, Client Data Services

Job Description

What is the Opportunity?

You will be working as part of the Data Management & Quality team. The purpose of the role is to ensure that all Client and Product data is input, controlled effectively and maintained appropriately for all WMI businesses and product lines.

What will you do?

  • Ensure the integrity of data across and between multiple systems is maintained
  • Complete data maintenance and supporting administrative tasks throughout the Client and Product lifecycle
  • Collaborate with stakeholders to ensure that all issues, queries and obstacles are satisfactorily resolved to ensure that tasks are completed in a timely and efficient manner
  • Contribute to the development and maintenance of an appropriate control environment in line with applicable data standards, regulatory requirements and business unit procedures
  • Contribute to the ongoing efficiency, innovations, process review and development of Data Management and Quality
  • Act as an SME to assist with Optimisation activities including the development of new RPA processes, Service Requests and core application development
  • Assist in the rotation and remediation of daily control reports and collation of task information for Management Information
  • Assist with the delivery and completion of User Acceptance Testing (UAT) and Post Implementation Verification (PIV) testing

What do you need to succeed?
Must-have

  • Strong communication, influencing and negotiating skills
  • Collaborative and consultative approach along with team player attitude
  • Ability to make decisions, use initiative and escalate issues
  • Ability to execute tasks within defined service level agreements
  • A proven track record in excellent service delivery
  • Knowledge/experience with Client Due Diligence (CDD) / Know Your Client (KYC) and supporting documentation
  • Ability and willingness to work from home in line with the hybrid working team charter

Nice-to-have

  • An understanding of client structures, primarily companies and trusts
  • Knowledge of VB and macros
  • Knowledge/Understanding of JIRA
  • Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Office products — specifically Word and Excel
  • Knowledge and understanding of Salesforce, RIBS, Milvus, Triple A, 5 Series, and Content Navigator

What is in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best - progressive thinking to keep growing and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper.  We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Opportunities to work with the best in the field
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Flexible working options fully supported

Job Summary

You will be working as part of the Data Management & Quality team. The purpose of the role is to ensure that all Client and Product data is input, controlled effectively and maintained appropriately for all WMI businesses and product lines.

item.title: Financial Reporting Analyst
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Financial Reporting Analyst

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

Join our growing RBC Global Asset Management (GAM) group! As Financial Reporting Analyst, you will provide support in the day-to-day operations and assist in preparation of financial statements and other related disclosures. You will also be involved in daily valuation and reporting of unit prices for assigned Mutual Funds within fixed deadlines enabling the unitholder systems to properly calculate the value of client’s holdings and process mutual fund transactions. For more information, please visit: https://www.rbcgam.com

What will you do?

  • Assist in preparation of annual and semi-annual financial statements of mutual funds and other related disclosures

  • Prepare data for the Management Report of Fund Performance including Top 25 and Investment Mix reports

  • Support month-end general ledger close process

  • Assist in preparation of operating reports for IFIC and other industry/regulatory organizations

  • Provide financial information and assistance to external and internal auditors

  • Support daily fund accounting activities such as cash, holdings and sub-ledger to ledger  reconciliations and other month end controls

  • Ensure all transactions (i.e. corporate actions, unitholder subscriptions and redemptions, management fees, expense accruals, security trades) are entered into the GL System accurately to ensure accuracy of financial data

  • Create and implement solutions to streamline financial reporting processes

  • Maintaining internal procedures/policies to ensure controls are followed.

  • Train staff on operational processes and assist senior staff with daily process queries

  • Assist the reporting activities including taking on ad-hoc requests

  • Work on specialized projects including Eagle Investment and Electra systems

 What you need to succeed?

 Must have: 

  • Post-Secondary education in Finance or related field

  • 3+ years relevant industry experience

  • Ability to work in a team environment with strong communication, time management and problem solving skills

  • Practical knowledge of financial products, Mutual Fund valuation and general ledger systems.

  • Experience with MS Excel, VBA/Macros

  • High attention to detail and accuracy.

 Nice to have:

  • Completion or working towards Finance/Accounting designation

  • Experience with Tableau and database queries, including SQL

  • Knowledge of SS&C Pacer, Electra Recon and Eagle Investment Systems

  • Experience with pricing/data applications Bloomberg and Thomson One Financial, etc.

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable

  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities

  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact

  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team

  • Opportunities to do challenging work

  • Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities    

  • Access to a variety of job opportunities across business and geographies

RBC is committed to supporting flexible work arrangements when and where available. Details to be discussed with Hiring Manager.
RBC requires as a condition of employment that all successful candidates in the United States and Canada be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to their start date, and may require proof of the same. Reasonable accommodation is available where required by law.

item.title: Securities Data Analyst
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Securities Data Analyst

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

The Securities Data Services (SDS) group within RBC\'s Reference Data Service’s group is responsible for the management of the organization\'s securities reference data repositories. As a Data Analyst you will assist with providing reusable, authoritative, timely, comprehensive, and consistent securities reference data across the organization with special focus on product taxonomy. 

You will play a key role in the management of the organizations securities reference data repository. Success will be accomplished by providing reference data expertise throughout Capital Markets and the operational support of the Securities Reference Data Repository (SRDR) as well as other internal and external repositories.

What will you do?

  • Provide front-line operational support for securities reference data
  • Setup and maintain securities reference data for fixed income, equity, and equity derivative securities, including corporate actions, ensuring that data is accurate and timely
  • Review/investigate data exceptions through the use of data query tools and remediate exceptions as necessary
  • Assist in the implementation of process improvement and system enhancement initiatives by identifying opportunities for automation and by researching the root cause of data quality issues.
  • Contribute to the department knowledge base by creating and updating documentation of supported processes

What you need to succeed?

Must-haves

  • University Degree
  • Good knowledge of different financial product types (fixed income, equity, derivatives, currency, commodities)
  • Advanced problem solving, analytical and decision-making skills
  • Experience in developing successful and responsive relationships with a wide number of groups at various levels
  • Good experience using MS Excel, MS Access, and Business Intelligence tools; intermediate to advanced MS Excel skills.
  • Expected daily start time: 10:30am Atlantic but subject to change

Nice-to-haves

  • Completion of the Canadian Securities Course (CSC)
  • Relevant work experience in the use of reference data across different product types (fixed income, equity, derivatives, currency, commodities) within an established financial institution, investment bank or fund management organization
  • Experience with the use of Bloomberg and Reuters Data (Corporate Actions, Reference Data)
  • Working knowledge of ADP/Broadridge settlement system
  • Experience with GoldenSource or any another enterprise data management system

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities 
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Opportunities to do challenging work
  • Flexible work/life balance options

RBC requires as a condition of employment that all successful candidates in the United States and Canada be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to their start date, and may require proof of the same.  Reasonable accommodation is available where required by law.

item.title: Analyst - Data Integrity & Key Controls
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Analyst - Data Integrity & Key Controls

Job Description

  • Support the Standardized Approach to Key Controls (SAKC) control identification methodology and ensure consistent application across all Critical Risk and Finance Reports and key business processes.
  • Gain and apply an in-depth understanding of key control groups (e.g. data input, data transfer, business rule, data quality, ITGC) and how each control type would most effectively apply in a given data flow or system scenario.
  • Evaluate any unmitigated risks and control weaknesses, and share recommendations for new or enhanced controls consistent with the Enterprise Data Policy.
  • Work with report and business process owners and delegates to understand exception scenarios, based on materiality thresholds, where critical data element instances or individuals systems might be immaterial.
  • Collaborate with lines of business (LOB) functions in the bank, other Data Management Offices (DMOs), SOX Office, and Audit to facilitate data control enhancement and/or implementation where needed.
  • Participate in some reviews of the CDE Memos, data lineage and control information for Finance, Risk and other critical reports, key business processes and data domains.
  • Provide support by tracking status of team objectives by maintaining and updating the team’s JIRA board on SAKC progress.

Must Have

  • 1-2+ years of experience in risk management, data management and business analysis.
  • Some experience with credit risk data, data quality principles, data control design, self-assessment of existing processes and systems.
  • Undergraduate degree in a numerical discipline, business administration or a combination.
  • Good communications skills, verbal and written.
  • Some experience with business and/or technical documentation and the assessment of existing processes and systems.

Nice to Have

  • Self-starter, highly motivated, having a strong drive to achieve tangible results.
  • Ability to manage multiple competing priorities in times of stress.
  • Ability to analyze and comprehend complex data related issues.
  • Familiarity with financial service regulatory requirements and guidelines (e.g. BCBS239, IFRS 9, CECL)

Job Summary

Reporting to the Associate Director, Data Integrity & Key Controls this role is a key contributor in ensuring the integrity, accuracy and completeness of Finance and Risk shared data assets and reporting data. The incumbent will support and perform effective key control assessments of critical reports and business process data. In addition, they will assess data lineage and control effectiveness within the Shared Data Management Operations (SDMO).

The incumbent will develop and maintain working relationships with line of business (LOB) and audit partners across the organization including Group Risk Management, Personal & Commercial Banking, Capital Markets, Finance, Wealth Management Internal/External Audit, SOX Office, and other enterprise functions.

item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Senior Application Support Analyst

Job Description

  • Ensuring that up-to-date job control language is maintained and documented for each program that is part of a scheduled production run.
  • Ensuring the documentation and tracking of all shift turnover issues.
  • Contributing to job scheduling and report distribution, as well as data center standards development and enforcement.
  • Monitoring the library to insure that the proper generation of data files are available for production runs and tracks resolution.

What will you do?

  • Responsible for ensuring maximum system availability, prompt and accurate remediation and response to issues and requests
  • Proactive management and governance of our applications
  • Leverage automation to drive efficiency and to improve the soundness of our operating environment
  • Ensure strict adherence to standard operating procedures, standing order guidelines, and governance best practices
  • Liaise/Partner closely between Business, Technology, Compliance, Surveillance, and Functional groups to help conduct regular review to help evolve our platform and to ensure the connectivity required to achieve our collective objectives
  • Responsible for ensuring maximum system availability and production stability
  • Responsible for rapid and precise remediation to issues with a bias towards automation and finding root clause.
  • Provide effective incident, problem and release management and regular project updates to stakeholders
  • Drive IT governance and de-risking initiatives
  • Deploy CI/CD pipelines across multiple environments into production
  • Lead effective knowledge sharing, documentation, and cross training to help maximize coverage and work to improve the robust of our follow-the-sun operating model

What do you need to succeed?

  • Must be extremely hands on, detail oriented, assertive and proactive with both day-to-day tasks and short and long-term deliveries
  • Proven ability to collaborate well with others, be strategically focused and realize continuous improvements
  • Prior in-depth experience in supporting large-scale, enterprise-wide, global trading and risk platforms
  • Consistently seeking to automate; Strong scripting skills (i.e., Python, PERL, etc.)
  • Solid working understanding of LINUX and SQL (including database concepts)
  • Good organization skills , ability to effectively context switch and thrive in a fast pace environment
  • Proficient in Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery (CI/CD) and maintain DevOps standards
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Strong interpersonal skills and self-starter attitude
  • Knowledge of messaging systems (i.e, Solace, MQ)
  • Knowledge of monitoring software (i.e. ITRS)
  • Knowledge of distributed software (i.e. Tibco DataSynapse)
  • Understanding of scheduling and build/deployment tools (i.e. Control-M, Jenkins)
  • Experience as a member of a team that is providing 24x7 coverage
  • Solid command of multi-assets (equities, equities derivatives, FX) systems.
  • Sophis experience is a plus or familiarity with complex risk systems.
  • Bachelors of Science degree or equivalent

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • Opportunity to contribute to the growth and success of our business and work with the platforms, technologies, and people needed to achieve our ambitions
  • Collaborate closely with different stakeholders and in different lines of business across different business and regions.
  • Challenging and rewarding work on complex and mission critical platforms
  • Platform to actively drive change to drive continuous improvements
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Wide variety of activities and projects that will challenge and stretch your capabilities
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact

Job Summary

The Production & Risk Service group is looking for a seasoned application support analyst to help support and drive the operations of a group of complex front to back applications that is used to calculate PNL, manage risk, and reconcile positions for our Front Office, Risk, Finance and Operations groups. We support fast-paced global businesses with evolving needs and requirements. Your ability to take ownership of our production estate combined with a natural sense of curiosity and pride in a job well done will help you success in the role.

Job Title

Senior Full Stack Developer

Job Description

City National bank (CNB) is a full-service US bank that offers a complement of banking, trust and investment services. In 2015, City National merged with Royal Bank of Canada. The company continues to invest in new talent, products, technology and capabilities. We’re building a team who is not afraid to challenge the status quo; embraces innovation; and excited to bring a fresh perspective. item.title: Senior DevOps/Platform Engineer
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Senior DevOps/Platform Engineer

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

The platform engineering team believes in automating everything, making data-driven decisions, minimizing friction for platform adoption and most of all embracing change. We believe in collaboration, collective ownership and continuous improvement. Our team is supporting multiple large scale initiatives across the business from personal and commercial banking, investor and treasury, wealth management and insurance.

As a senior platform engineer you will be responsible to build out various big data platforms using Cloud, Hadoop and Container based technologies for real-time stream, batch processing and analytics. This role will take on challenges of scaling out systems for performance and multi-tenancy across all dimensions using cutting-edge technology.

What will you do?

  • Work on large scale clusters on premise and in the Cloud
  • Scale out clusters and services to many use cases and hundreds of applications
  • Design and build resilient and highly available multi-tenant solutions
  • Deploy and test out new technologies such as Kubernetes, Ozone, CDP Experiences
  • Desire to grow and learn Cloud based big data technologies
  • Automate and secure everything
  • Embrace change

What you need to succeed?

Must have

  • Bachelor\'s degree majoring in Computer Science, or related fields, or at least 5 years of related work experience
  • Experience with distributed systems, designing and building for resiliency and performance
  • Experience with building platforms on AWS and/or Azure cloud
  • Experience with container-based platforms
  • Automation via REST APIs
  • Automation via Python programming
  • Experience with Linux administration (CentOS, RHEL, Ubuntu)
  • Experience with Ansible, Git and general CI/CD tools and processes
  • Experience with network administration
  • Experience with system and network security best practices. 
  • Open mind, a desire to learn and to be challenged
  • Sound judgement

Nice to have

item.title: Data Scientist
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Data Scientist

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

In this role as a Data Scientist, you will analyze, design, and implement data science/machine learning solutions using RBC’s enterprise suite of analytics tools.  The group specializes in taking full advantage of large data sets to explore and discover new insights that would have not been possible with traditional analytics.  Leveraging leading-edge technologies and capabilities, the group applies machine learning and statistical modeling techniques to help RBC understand the changing business environment, discover new growth opportunities and determine where business improvements can be made.       

What will you do?

  • Work with business partners and stakeholders to understand the problem statement/business objective and accordingly develop machine learning algorithms to identify these complex threat scenarios that are able to evade traditional detection tools.
  • Prototype the algorithms for execution in the Hadoop environment, GPU and cloud environments.
  • Work with business stakeholders, internal and external QA to ensure that the final product is of the highest quality and is able to meet pre-defined business objects.
  • Collaborate with application development and data engineering team to deploy a scalable batch/real-time model to production.
  • Support the development of a proactive approach to threat detection and/or misuse identification.
  • Train and mentor junior employees when applicable.
  • Participate in Proof of Concept or Proof of Technology projects to evaluate cybersecurity technologies and platforms.
  • Operate third-party technologies to analyze security data and identify threats and misuse cases, and evaluate capabilities of those technologies.
  • Participate in the creation of detailed plans and accurate estimates towards the development, testing, and implementation of proactive threat detection capabilities.
  • Contribute to successful completion of projects by identifying risks and developing/recommending mitigation strategies.

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have:

  • A background in Computer Science, Computational Science, Mathematics, or a related field.
  • Solid knowledge of general Machine Learning concepts both in theory and application and experience with advanced topics like Deep Learning, NLP, etc.
  • Experience with data preprocessing, feature and representation learning, and anomaly/outlier detection.
  • Advanced programming skills in one or more of the following languages: Python, R, Scala.
  • Experience with big data processing technologies like Spark.
  • Knowledge of Parallel Programming and High-Performance Computing.

Nice-to-have:

  • Knowledge of network and information security. 
  • Knowledge of the Hadoop and GPU ecosystem.
  • Advanced programming skills in one or more of the following languages: PyTorch, TensorFlow.
  • Ability to develop statistical tests and run controlled trials.

What’s in it for you?

  • We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Opportunities to do challenging work

item.title: Portfolio Management Consultant (Portfolio Modeling)
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Portfolio Management Consultant (Portfolio Modeling)

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

  • Conduct one-on-one meetings with both discretionary and non-discretionary teams to determine their investment philosophy and implementation strategy.
  • Build and maintain relationships with new and existing Portfolio Managers (discretionary licensed Investment Advisors) and their teams within Dominion Securities.
  • Discuss best practices regarding Investment Policy Statements, asset mix monitoring, quarterly reviews, review processes, service plans, etc. to assist in streamlining their investment process and operations.
  • Help set up the advisors book to prepare for portfolio modeling and also discuss ongoing management of the book for new clients, multiple legal registrations within the same household, withdrawals or deposits for existing clients, changes in asset mix for a client, or tactical or geographic asset class changes.
  • Assist new employees /competitive recruits in becoming familiar with trading and modeling platforms (TradeLink, ClientLink, A+ Desktop, TAC).
  • Help teams modify their investment management philosophy when necessary and liaise with the Managed Solutions Group, the Portfolio Overlay Team and the Portfolio Advisory Group, gathering feedback and suggestions for modeling and portfolio management improvements.
  • Lay the groundwork to build scalable Unified Managed Household tools (A+) for both discretionary and non-discretionary advisors.
  • Specific to ClientLink modeling for discretionary and advisory teams, assist with various aspects of portfolio management: creating models and attaching portfolios, running trade lists, walking through exceptions that need to be built into the system, and running through exceptions in client accounts.
  • Outline how to move forward and deal with every day transactions; withdrawals, deposits, currency conversions, etc., and help set up their book to get it ready for modeling and bulk trading, and assist with training on integration into our discretionary platform.
  • Be responsible for covering a region that spans South-Western and Central Ontario, consisting of approximately 20 Dominion Securities branches.

What do you need to succeed?

Must Have

  • A minimum of 5 years in the financial services industry, preferably with Dominion Securities
  • Strong interpersonal skills (empathetic listener, coach, and negotiator) and strong communication and presentation skills. Comfortable meeting new people, engaging with them, and building those relationships.
  • Driven, eager to learn and thrives in a high-performance environment.
  • CFA Level 1 or CIM, or, strong and proven understanding of discretionary money management.
  • Willingness to travel (mix of either day trips or flights) for a combined total average of two weeks per month, often for one to four days at a time, with some overnight travel required.
  • Advanced computer skills, with emphasis on Excel.

Nice to Have

  • Fluency in French (spoken and written).
  • Ideal candidate would have background in Dominion Securities Retail branch environment, preferably with a discretionary team (3+ years’ experience) including processes, technology, products & services.  Familiarity with portfolio management concepts/techniques preferred.
  • Ability to analyze, prioritize and adjust to multiple demands. Good problem solving skills and customer service focus required.
  • Must thrive at managing change in both a team and independent environment.
  • Enjoys traveling for work.

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable.
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities.
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact.
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team.
  • Flexible work/life balance options.
  • Opportunities to do challenging work.
  • Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities.

RBC is committed to supporting flexible work arrangements when and where available. Details to be discussed with Hiring Manager.

RBC requires as a condition of employment that all successful candidates in the United States and Canada be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to their start date, and may require proof of the same. Reasonable accommodation is available where required by law.

Job Summary

What is the opportunity?

In this role, you will provide insight and advice on portfolio management best practices, linking conceptual strategies of trading and rebalancing portfolios.
You will assist teams in making knowledgeable decisions and analysis of business practices relating to modeling, bulk trading and other desktop applications, with the goal of arriving at solutions to avoid trading issues/errors, and growing a scalable business.
You will train teams on the use of technology that may increase workflow efficiencies, and coach them on how to better utilize our existing systems in order to optimize their various processes.
You will add value by offering subject matter expertise to discretionary licensed investment advisors in modeling, bulk trading, and portfolio management best practices. You’ll also offer expertise to discretionary advisory teams working with our Unified Managed Account (A+) platform.

item.title: Senior Site Reliability Engineer
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Senior Site Reliability Engineer

Job Description

Senior Site Reliability Engineer

Are you a strong self-starter motivated by development and automation? 

Do you have a ‘can-do’ attitude?  If so – WE WANT YOU!!

As a Senior Site Reliability Engineer, you will join a team of highly motivated individuals that are working to rethink operations by transforming the current process to the Next Generation Operating Model in DevOps Services. RBC creates more value through innovation and technology, and DevOps services is the core enabler for the RBC technology advantage.

This role will be responsible for the development, implementation and support of Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) solutions for DevOps Services. You will work collaboratively with the engineering and operations team to eliminate operational toil and taking operations and tools resiliency to the next level.

What will you do?

  • Champion Stability and Reliability across DevOps applications and services:
    • Work with Application Custodians and Operational Engineers to improve service reliability by reducing service degradation
    • Participate in incident root cause analysis to avoid reoccurrence
    • Continuously improving monitoring and alerting
  • Solution self-healing processes and automate incident response
  • Own and report on
    • SRE Metrics—including incident metrics - gather and analyze metrics from both operating systems and applications to assist in performance tuning and fault finding.
    • DevOps applications’ SLO and create error budgets
  • Lead effort to identify and automate toil
  • Evaluate continuously – what went well, what went wrong, what can be done to improve and prevent in future
  • Provide guidance to other team members on managing end-to-end availability and performance of mission critical services, on building automation to prevent problem recurrence, and on building automated responses for non-exceptional service conditions
  • Manage individual projects priorities, deadlines, and deliverables using Agile approach
  • Some after hours and weekend support

 

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent practical experience
  • 4+ years of experience implementing SRE best practices
  • Hands-on experience using ELK Stack, Dynatrace, Moogsoft, PagerDuty, ServiceNow, Ansible, and GitHub
  • Hands-on experience scripting in Windows and Linux environment using PowerShell, Shell Scripting, Python, and Node.JS
  • Solid understanding of infrastructure component like VMs, load balancer, networking, and Open Shift
  • Ability to pick up new tools and concepts quickly, learn other coding languages as needed
  • Hands-on technical leadership experience, producing technical documentation, and contributing to technical direction

Nice to have:

  • Experience implementing and consuming DevOps pipeline is a plus
  • Experience using Postgres, MySQL, or MS SQL
  • Prior development experience as a full stack or back-end developer
  • Use Pivotal Cloud Foundry, Jenkins, Jira, and Confluence

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • A world-class training program in financial services
  • Flexible work/life balance options
  • Opportunities to do challenging work and take on progressively greater accountabilities

RBC requires as a condition of employment that all successful candidates in the United States and Canada be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to their start date, and may require proof of the same. Reasonable accommodation is available where required by law.

Full Stack Developer

item.description:

Job Title

Senior Technical Systems Analyst- SAP CRM

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

If you enjoy working with talented professionals, who are passionate about delivering excellence to their customers and would like to work for an organization which provides plenty of growth opportunities, you may consider applying for the following position.

As a SAP CRM WEB UI Senior Technical Systems Analyst within the Core Banking Integration group, you will become a part of the Linx Development team, responsible for providing technology solutions in the Mortgage Origination space. You will partner with other Linx SAP teams (Functional and Basis), and you would have the opportunity to communicate directly with various lines of business, to design and build new capabilities and services in the existing system.

We are looking for a talented person who is a great team player and would like to work in an Agile environment, who is passionate about the quality of their work and the good solution design.

What will you do?

  • Assess, research and analyze business and system needs, exploring alternative options to recommend technology solutions and designs that meet sponsor needs and PLC deliverables including component reusability, data sharing and security
  • Prepare high level and detailed technical specifications for small to medium complexity projects involving SAP CRM WEB UI, ABAP, and or Adobe Forms features according to PLC, security and architecture documentation objectives
  • Contribute to successful project completion by identifying risks and developing/recommending mitigation strategies
  • Develop, code, document and execute unit test, system, integration and acceptance test using SAP ABAP, and testing tools
  • Develop detailed plans and accurate estimates for completion of build, system testing and implementation phases
  • Perform performance tuning to improve performance over multiple functions
  • Effectively communicate and builds rapport with team members, stakeholders and interface groups using a variety of techniques and collaboration from initiation to close
  • Facilitate small to large group meetings for technical design, decision making, problem solving and task implementation

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • Professional with experience on SAP applications with multiple functions
  • E2E Project experience in SAP CRM 7.0 ABAP Development (Advanced level ABAP Object Oriented Programming skills)
  • E2E Project experience in SAP CRM WEB UI Development (e.g. BSP components, GENIL/BOL, AET, CRM Event Handler and Post Processing Framework (PPF))
  • E2E Project experience in Smart Forms, Adobe Forms Development, ODATA, Interfaces (ABAP Proxy development), BAPI, BADI and RFC
  • Experience with SAP PI
  • Excellent communication skills with the ability to manage time effectively
  • Familiarity with Agile methodology

Nice-to-have

  • Sound knowledge of CRM Sales Module and SAP CRM Account origination flow/business idea
  • Experience with AUnit and E-CATT
  • Core Java, Java Spring Boot / Spring Cloud framework

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. item.title: Application Performance Management Engineer
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Application Performance Management Engineer

Job Description

What will you do? 

  • Work with internal partners to solve monitoring requirements
  • Implement custom metrics, SLOs, extensions, dashboards, integrations.
  • Maintenance of tooling infrastructure (support, test, and deploy patches and updates)
  • Engineer new solutions with teams to implement platform or technology integrations
  • Work with teams to troubleshoot issues related to performance or product compatibility
  • Provide input on longer term strategic tooling decisions such as new tools, opportunities to rationalize existing toolsets, and close operational gaps
  • Document Use Cases and Operational information
  • On-Call rotation split with existing team members for Application Support

What do you need to succeed?

Must Have 

  • High level of knowledge with Dynatrace – certification preferred
  • Experience with Dynatrace Agent deployment techniques on various platforms including: Windows, Linux, AIX, z/OS, PCF, OpenShift, Azure, AWS, GCS.
  • Experience with installation and configuration of Dynatrace ActiveGates.
  • Experience with configuration of Dynatrace tagging rules, extensions, RUM, custom metrics, SLOs, alert profiles, dashboards, synthetics.
  • Experience with use of Dynatrace APIs.
  • Experience with Dynatrace license management of Host Units, DEM, DDU, AppSec, etc.
  • Experience troubleshooting application issues, providing walk through of features. 
  • Application Management Experience (Operations, Patching, Upgrades, Vendor Relationship Management).
  • Good understanding of Operating Systems such as Windows, Linux, AIX (z/OS a bonus).
  • Good understanding of Cloud platforms such as PCF, OpenShift, AWS, Azure.
  • Good understanding of development technologies and concepts. (i.e. Java, .Net) Development experience a big plus.
  • Good understanding of application server technologies such as WebSphere, Tomcat, Nginx, etc.
  • Good understanding of other monitoring tools and capabilities (i.e. Zabbix, Prometheus, Nagios, SCOM, etc.).
  • Good understanding of ITSM and SRE principles.
  • Great communication skills, experience with running meetings and presenting complex ideas, experience working with a dynamic team.
  • Experience with OS Native Scripting (Shell Scripting, Bash, PowerShell).

Nice to Have 

  • Programming experience.
  • Familiarity with PagerDuty, Moogsoft, and ServiceNow.
  • Familiarity with Elastic and or Splunk.
  • Familiarity with networking technologies and concepts.
  • Experience with APM platforms other than Dynatrace (i.e. DataDog, App Dynamics, New Relic, etc.).
  • Experience as a Team Leader or Project Manager.
  • Creating Application Architecture documentation (Diagrams, Support Docs)

item.title: Senior Developer
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Senior Developer

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

As a Senior Developer, you will be working in a development capacity on our application suite which includes our Java-based applications and services, and our mainframe cards and transactions system.

We have several web-based and cloud Java applications leveraging a variety of technologies, methodologies, tools and deployment platforms.

The core application is a large, sophisticated mainframe-based system which connects RBC clients to their banking products and services.

What will you do?

  • Design, develop, test, deploy, support and evolve software to deliver banking services.
  • Manage individual priorities, deadlines and deliverables.
  • Assess and analyze business and technical requirements in order to provide estimates on activities/tasks and establish detailed plans and timelines
  • Create, update and contribute to critical documentation relevant to the projects
  • Effectively communicate and build rapport with team members, various IT partners and 3rd party vendors
  • Available for after-hours production support when needed (rare)

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • Completion of a 3-4 year post-secondary education
  • Outstanding communication skills (written and verbal)
  • Strong background in software development
  • Experience in J2EE and Cloud API Java development

Nice-to-have

  • Familiarity with IBM RAD, Spring Framework and Java development tools
  • Experience with WebSphere Application Server, OpenShift Cloud Platform, Pivotal Cloud Platform
  • Awareness of IMS TMRA, IMS Connect, z/OS Connect Enterprise Edition
  • Understanding of DevOps automation

item.title: Sr. SQL Server Database Administrator Specialist
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Sr. SQL Server Database Administrator Specialist

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

Data and Analytics (DNA) team is looking for a Senior SQL Server Database Administrator.  The DBA will oversee the creation and maintenance of database & transaction processing environments for application testing, pre-Production verification, and production operation. You will provide technical support for transaction processing, data access, performance tuning, and database recovery.  The Database Administrator will provide DBA services to a portfolio of applications across lines of business and across the whole RBC enterprise. 

What will you do?

  • Lead in the support of database and transaction management technology and it’s deployment and usage standards.
  • Lead application development and support teams in optimal use of database and transaction management technology through creation and communication of standards and walkthrough of critical application components.
  • Ensure that databases are optimally designed, so that applications meet their defined SLA s, reuse of existing database structures is maximized and operational costs are minimized
  • Provide leadership in ensuring all database and environmental changes are appropriately tested and implemented in such a manner that there is no impact on RBC systems and clients.
  • Provide strong technical knowledge and business subject matter expertise across a wide range of database technologies, with a primary focus on SQL servers. 
  • Provide database-related technical support for development and production environment including required level of 7X24 on-call support.
  • Define, develop and meet various SLAs for multiple database platforms used in the company.
  • Improve and optimize database administration and management with coding and automation with a focus on performance, high availability, reliability, and reduce TOIL using SRE practices.
  • Build self-service and self-managing capabilities of our database as a service infrastructure.

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • 10+ years of proven working experience in Microsoft SQL Server technology and current on SQL Server releases (i.e. SQL Server 2012, 2014, 2016, 2017, 2019)
  • In-depth technical knowledge of database and transaction management technologies and operating systems
  • Experienced with data manipulation languages, data definition languages, physical database design, and application performance analysis & tuning
  • Experience in providing L3/L4 support in troubleshooting SQL Server performance-related issues.
  • Expert knowledge to analyze performance issues, identify tuning opportunities, implement improvements and advise developers on SQL Server
  • Intermediate knowledge of support and maintaining SQL server on Linux platform 
  • Experience automating routine DBA tasks using scripts or CI/CD pipelines

Nice-to-have

  • Some knowledge of public cloud (i.e.
  • Some knowledge of  containerization
  • Managing SQL Server on containers (i.e. Docker, Kubernetes, etc…)
  • Nice to have other NoSQL Databases platforms
  • Knowledge of DevOps pipeline (i.e. git and JIRA)
  • Coaching/mentoring skills
  • Good verbal and written communication skills
  • Attention to client focus and client service

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual. 

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable

  • Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities         
  • Opportunities to build close relationships with clients
  • Access to a variety of job opportunities across business and geographies
